data.code_commit_message:
feat(ANEM): MUL→HI:LO write path and BZ_N negate polarity fix

Route the ALU's full 32-bit multiply product to HI:LO registers so
MFHI/MFLO can read MUL results (MIPS convention for LLVM backend).
MUL also keeps writing the low 16 bits to the destination register
for backward compatibility.

Fix BZ_N (branch-if-not-zero) which was completely broken — p_bztrue
only checked Z=1, never inverting for the negate variant. Add
bz_negate signal through pipeline; XOR with Z flag. This fixes every
LLVM-compiled loop using SGT + BZ_N.
